newsitem.title: USA: Deere to build combines through China pact.
newsitem.headline: Deere to build combines through China pact.

text.p: Deere & Co said Wednesday it will hold a 60 percent stake in a joint venture to make combines with Jiamusi Combine Harvester Factory in China.

The venture, John Deere Jialian Harvester Co Ltd, will have $29 million in assets and will produce combines designed for use in China as well as for eventual export to the Asia-Pacific region, Deere said.
The facility, located in Heilongjiang Province in China, will begin production during 1997, Deere said.

"While the company's combine technology has been licensed in China since the early 1980s, this joint venture is the first time Deere will have an ownership interest in an agricultural equipment manufacturing operation in China," Ron Sonnenburg, Deere director of China operations, said in a statement.
Deere is the largest manufacturer of agricultural equipment in the world.
